pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.4_0: The training rule on building dwellings
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10_0: Venerable Channa in the same manner.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11_0: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you had a tree felled that had served as a shrine and that was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you do such a thing?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.16_0: People perceive trees as living beings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.17_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1_0: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20_0: he must get monks to approve a site where no harm will be done and which has a space on all sides.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21_0: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks a space on all sides, or he does not get monks to approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2_0: At that time a householder who was a supporter of Venerable Channa said to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.3_0: “Venerable, please find a site for a dwelling, and I’ll have one built for you.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4_0: While Venerable Channa was clearing a site for that dwelling, he had a tree felled that had served as a shrine and that was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.5_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have such a tree felled?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.7_0: But not soulling the Sakyan ascetics treading the same thing.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.11_0: He must stay on the site for a dwelling
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.12_0: The monk who is building a dwelling should clear a site. He should then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.13_0: ‘Venerables, I wish to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.14_0: I request the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.15_0: And they should ask a second
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.16_0: And they should ask a third time.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.17_0: If the whole Sangha is able to inspect the site, they should all go.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.18_0: If the whole Sangha is not able to inspect the site,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.19_0: then those monks there who are competent and capable—who know where harm will be done and where no harm will be done, and who understands the meaning of space on all sides and a lacks a space on all sides—should be asked and then appointed.
